intro: Argomuellera stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf argomuellera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
